intro: Tithymalus acalyphoides, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
